NationalSymbols.Flag: A red field featuring a white crescent and a star with a white silhouette of Cyprus superimposed on the hoist side
NationalSymbols.CoatOfArms: A shield displaying a white map of Cyprus with olive branches, set against a red background

Geography.Location: Eastern Mediterranean, comprising the northern portion of the island of Cyprus

IndependenceAndFormation.HistoricalBackground: Following intercommunal conflict and the Turkish invasion of Cyprus in 1974, the northern region declared independence in 1983. It is recognized only by Turkey.

Economy.Currency: Turkish Lira (₺) (TRY) – officially used; Euros are also common in tourism

Infrastructure.CallingCode: +90 (unofficial, as North Cyprus uses Turkey’s code)

HistoricalContext.AncientHistory: Part of ancient Cyprus with Greek, Phoenician, and Roman settlements
HistoricalContext.MedievalPeriod: Ruled by Byzantines, Lusignans, Venetians, and Ottomans
HistoricalContext.ModernEra: Came under British colonial rule until 1960; division of Cyprus followed intercommunal tensions and the 1974 Turkish invasion
HistoricalContext.PoliticalStatus: De facto independent since 1983; recognized only by Turkey

CulturalAspects.Language: Turkish (primary); English widely used in business and tourism
CulturalAspects.Cuisine: Meze, kebabs, fresh seafood, and local Cypriot specialties
CulturalAspects.UNESCOWorldHeritage: Several archaeological sites and historic landmarks, though most UNESCO sites are in the internationally recognized southern part of Cyprus

GeopoliticalFeatures.Location: Eastern Mediterranean, on the island of Cyprus
Borders: De jure borders with the Republic of Cyprus (entire island)
GeopoliticalFeatures.Territories: De facto control of the northern third of Cyprus

Organizations: Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) – as observer
Various international economic and cultural forums (limited participation due to non-recognition)
